result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant David A. Perry in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-208, 15CF-101, 15CF-134 and 15CF-45.

11:02 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

Two of the files, there has not been a waiver of prelim or arraignment.

15CF-134:
Waiver of preliminary hearing.
Defendant is waiving right of preliminary hearing. Defendant understands. 
Court addresses purpose of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Defendant.
Court will find probable cause, enters a bind over, and accepts the information.
Atty Drengler received a copy of the information, waives reading and enter pleas of NOT GUILTY on all counts.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant enters pleas of NOT GUILTY on the two counts

15CF-208:
Initial Appearance.
Atty Drengler received a copy of the criminal complaint, waives reading.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant is waiving right of preliminary hearing. Defendant understands.
Court addresses purpose of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Defendant.
Court will find probable cause, enters a bind over, and accepts the information.
Atty Drengler received a copy of the information, waives reading and enter pleas of NOT GUILTY on all counts.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant enters pleas of NOT GUILTY on the two counts

15CF-45 and 15CF-134 Defendant will plead to.
15CF-45: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 dismissed and read in
180 day jail sentence, imposed/stayed, probation 24 months, AODA and comply, no controlled substances w/o valid prescription, take medications only as prescribed, no drug parapheralia, not associate, sign releases, obt/mtn ft empt, other counseling, submit DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge
15CF-134: Defendant will plead ot Count 1. Count 2 dismissed and read in
180 day jail sentence, imposed/stayed consecutive, 24 months probation concurrent, same conditions

Defense is free to argue.

15CF-101 and 15CF-208 would be dismissed and read in
The bond in 15CF-101 may be applied to court costs.

Atty Drengler concurs, addresses early discharge.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF-45: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-134: Count 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Defendant agrees with previous conviction.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-45: Count 1: 961.41(3g)(e)   939.62(1)(b)
15CF-45: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-134: Count 1: 946.49(1)(b)  939.62(1)(b)
15CF-134: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-101: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-208: Dismissed and Read In

Parties will continue without a PSI.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.

Court agrees with agreement.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-45:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed
4 Days Credit if revoked
Huber granted for work
After 90 days, balance may be on home detention if Defendant qualifies for program
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
AODA and comply with any recommendations
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescripton
If have a valid prescription, take only as prescribed
No to posess drug paraphernalia
Not to associate with anyone possessing or consuming controlled substances
Sign necessary releases of information for the agent so agent can obtain information regarding prescription and pharmacy
Maintain full time employment
Participate in other counseling as recommended by the agent
Submit DNA sample
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay costs

15CF-134:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed, Consecutive to 15CF-45
Huber granted for work
After 90 days are served, balance may be on home detention, if Defendant qualifies for home detention
Probation for a period fo 24 Months, Concurrent to 15CF-45
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 15CF-45
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge

$500 bond posted in 15CF-101 is ordered applied to fines/costs/surcharges. Balance to be paid on an arrangement between Defendant and agent.
If Defendant successfully completes probation and the agent recommends, Defendant may be entitle to early discharge.

Defendant David A. Perry in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Informations.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bonds Continued.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.

1:52 p.m. Defendant David A. Perry in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Cash bond of $500 with comply with conditions previously set forth in 15CF45.

11:35 a.m.
ADA Knappen  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of felony bail jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a cash bond of $500 with comply with conditions previously set forth in 15CF45.
Defendant makes statement to the court


BTC:
Cash bond of $500 with comply with conditions previously set forth in 15CF45.


Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  04-6-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
